issue.title: reverse_iterator should not require a second copy of the base iterator

discussion.blockquote: [ Note: This operation must use an auxiliary member variable rather than a temporary variable to avoid returning a reference that persists beyond the lifetime of its associated iterator. (See 24.2.) —end note ]
discussion.p: is incorrect because such iterator implementations are ruled out by /6, where it says:
discussion.blockquote: If a and b are both dereferenceable, then a == b if and only if *a and *b are bound to the same object.
discussion.p:
Alisdair: sugested to strike the "exposition only" member.
Daniel: we must check that it wouldn't conflict with a previous solution to another issue.
Dietmar: This is an issue but the proposing word is not correct. When we have proxies inside the sequence.
Solution: NAD thanks to a contrieved example by Dietmar.

blockquote.del: [ Note: This operation must use an auxiliary member variable rather than a temporary variable to avoid returning a reference that persists beyond the lifetime of its associated iterator. (See 24.2.) —end note ]
